intro: Cirsium parietinum, commonly known as the rock thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, leafy stems and large, purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in mountainous or coastal regions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with serrated edges and covered in fine hairs. Cirsium parietinum is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
